page.title: 06METHERSGATE QUAY : SUTTON
page.content:
{Methersgate Hall}Drive , although privately owned, provides a footpath for the public through the beautifully tranquil and healthy countryside. On either side, field upon field of sugarbeet meets the eye as you walk in the pleasant shade through an avenue of trees.
Halfway along the drive, a small dilapidated white cottage is huddled in amongst the trees, where someone is attempting to cultivate a vegetable patch. This is{Cliff Farm. {} Turning left and up the hill you pass a magnificent brick mansion, {Methersgate Hall.}From there a small path leads to{Methersgate Quay, also privately owned.
